receiver.helpText: The wallet that receives the tokens
receiver.label: Recipient

actionComposer.placeholder: Filter by action, contract name or address

description.helpText: Summarize your governance process and its role in your organization in 2-3 sentences. This summary will be shown on the Proposals page, transparently describing how proposals of this type are governed.
description.label: Summary

key.helpText: Define a unique and recognizable prefix for this governance process so that each proposal has a unique ID. For example, CORE would be identifiable as CORE-1, CORE-2, etc.
key.label: Key

name.helpText: Give your governance process a short and easily identifiable name. Examples: Protocol Upgrades, Grants, Metagovernance, etc.
name.label: Name

resources.helpText: You can add additional external resources that helps give extra context about this type of proposal and its governance process.

eligibleVoters.bodiesDescription: Select which governing bodies are able to create proposals
eligibleVoters.label: Who is eligible to create this type of proposal?

tokenMinRequirementInput.helpText: The voting power or token balance needed to create proposals.
tokenMinRequirementInput.label: Minimum requirement

votingBodies.error: You must select at least one governing body.
votingBodies.label: Governing Bodies

bodies.helpText: Add the governing bodies that get to determine whether or not this stage passes.

helpText.vetoing: The amount of bodies that must veto this proposal in order to prevent the proposal from advancing to the next stage.
helpText.voting: The amount of bodies that must approve the proposal in order for it to advance to the next stage.

name.helpText: Give the stage a name that describes its role in the process. Examples: Community Review, Guardian Veto, Founder Signoff, etc.
name.label: Name

earlyAdvance.helpText: Should the proposal be advanceable to subsequent stages early if it is approved prior to the end of the voting period?
earlyAdvance.label: Early stage advance

expiration.helpText: The amount of additional time after the voting period in which the proposal will be eligible to be advanced to the next stage.
expiration.label: Stage expiration

dialog.helpInfo: Recommended minimum expiration time is 7 days.
dialog.title: Edit timing

votingPeriod.helpText: The amount of time that the bodies in this stage have to vote on proposals.
votingPeriod.label: Voting period

timing.helpText: Configure the stage's timing settings, such as the amount of time available to vote.
timing.label: Timing

type.helpText: Specify the role that governance plays. In a normal stage, a proposal will only pass if it approved. However, an optimistic stage reverses it this - it will pass unless vetoed.
type.label: What kind of stage is this?

METADATA.description: The information you provide on this page will be displayed alongside proposals of this type. It is purely informational, used to help voters understand the governance process and make a more informed decision.
METADATA.name: Process description
METADATA.title: Describe new proposal type

PERMISSIONS.description: Define who is eligible to create proposals of this type.
PERMISSIONS.name: Proposal creation rules
PERMISSIONS.title: Set proposal creation rules

STAGES.description: Design the process for deciding whether or not a proposal of this type passes and its actions executed. The proposals can go through any number of sequential stages. Within each stage, governing bodies can either approve or veto the proposal.
STAGES.name: Governance design
STAGES.title: Design the governance process

actions.empty: Add actions by selecting them, interacting with custom contracts, uploading actions or connect with any DApp.

actions.helpText: You may add actions to this proposal, which are onchain transactions that can only be executed if the proposal passes.
actions.label: Yes
actions.title: Would you like to add actions?

body.helpText: Describe the proposal fully for voters.
body.title: Body

resources.helpText: Add any resources that are relevant to your proposal. This could be a link to a document, a website, or a forum post.

summary.helpText: Describe your proposal in 2-3 sentences. This gives your voters a sense of the proposal and will appear in the proposal overview.
summary.title: Summary

title.helpText: Give your proposal a title. This will appear in the proposal overview.
title.title: Title

ACTIONS.description: These actions can be executed only once the governance parameters are met
ACTIONS.name: Set actions
ACTIONS.title: Define content

METADATA.description: Provide the information voters will need to make their decision here
METADATA.name: Define content
METADATA.title: Define content

SETTINGS.description: Define the settings for this proposal.
SETTINGS.name: Proposal settings
SETTINGS.title: Proposal settings

endTime.helpText: Define when a proposal should expire. After the expiration time, there is no way to approve or execute the proposal.
endTime.infoText: It’s recommended to have an expiration time of {{days}} days, so you have a clean proposal list.
endTime.label: Expiration time

startTime.helpText: Define when a proposal should be active to receive approvals. If now is selected, the proposal is immediately active after publishing.
startTime.label: Start time

advanceStageDialog.description: To advance the proposal to the next stage you have to confirm the onchain transaction with your wallet.
advanceStageDialog.title: Advance proposal

startTime.helpText: Define when the first stage should start. If now is selected, the first stage is immediately active after publishing.
startTime.label: Start time

sppVotingTerminal.description: The proposal must pass the voting to be accepted and potential onchain actions to execute.
sppVotingTerminal.title: Voting

endTime.helpText: Define how long the voting should last in days, or add an exact date and time for it to conclude.
endTime.infoText: The minimum duration of {{days}} days, {{hours}} hours, and {{minutes}} minutes is defined by DAO governance settings
endTime.label: End time

startTime.helpText: Define when a proposal should be active to receive approvals. If now is selected, the proposal is immediately active after publishing.
startTime.label: Start time

tokenGovernanceSettings.proposalAccess: Members with ≥ {{balance}} {{symbol}} voting power or balance

ADMIN_PLUGIN.message: This DAO is under construction. One or more admins can make any change to the DAO without a proposal

confirmWizardExit.message: If you leave this process, you'll lose all the information you've entered so far.

errorFeedback.description: If you'd like to help, please report the issue to our team.
errorFeedback.title: Something went wrong

invalid.description: Some values are not valid. Review and fix the invalid data to proceed.
invalid.title: Invalid data

invalid-required.description: Some inputs are not filled and not valid. Review, fix and fill out all mandatory data to proceed.
invalid-required.title: Missing and invalid data

required.description: Some inputs are not filled. Review and fill out all mandatory data to proceed.
required.title: Missing data
